list_definition.definition: (of) a mixture containing tar, used to make roads, pavements/sidewalks etc

list_ex_of_english: There is some accumulation, but it is not so bad as it was when there was an asphalt surface.
Porous asphalt is an open textured road surfacing material that permits surface water to drain through it rather than to remain on the surface.
Playing-fields are generally considered to be something different from playgrounds, the former having a grass surface and the latter an asphalt one.
I understand that the police and fire service found no evidence suggesting that the asphalt load contributed to the accident or the ensuing fire.
Asphalt had risen by a point since then.
If we invested more money in porous asphalt and other road surfaces, noise impact would be reduced.
The costs for porous asphalt were for resurfacing only.
Proper compaction is one of many essential requirements of the asphalt specification.
